dialogue: Do you girls mind moving a little, a little fucken faster? Everyone else is out there, you’re the only ones taking your time like you’re at fucken brunch.
Excuse me, you know who gives a shit? I do. I give a shit. My job that you girls get on stage.
Have we ever not made it on stage, Eddie?
Cue 453, go.
Are you okay?
...Muffy told me that the show is closing.
Sorry, what?
The show is closing.
She’s not senile. Are you-- I mean, what did she say?
These new casino owners, they want to put their own stamp on a place. They brought in the circus-- that show’s doing really well--
It is?? I just think who puts money into a circus that’s not Cirque du Soleil, right? That’s dumb--
That’s the whole point. It’s alternative, it’s dirty--
A dirty circus?
Yeah, you know, it’s edgy-- it’s for adults.
Le Razzle Dazzle-- it’s old, it’s the only show left of its kind on the strip.
But the fact that it’s the only one left-- that’s why it’s so special! I mean our show is a show! Come on! -- The costumes, the sets.
I think we’re gonna get notice tomorrow.
Are you kidding? You heard this from-- from Muffy?
Yeah.
Oh hey, Shell--
Thanks. Since we lost those shows, these checks feel like they’re getting slimmer and slimmer, you know?
Yeah.
Hey Eddie? Are you sure this is right? It’s less than I thought it would be.
Well it’s less because less shows.
Well, I know that, obviously, but I thought it would just be eight hundred divided by eleven shows a week, minus the three shows we lost.
You might have been making slightly more for the ones we lost cuz those shows were better sold. Generally.
Oh.
If you want I can check with accounts payable?
Nah, it’s okay. They’re not gonna do anything about it, right?
Probably...
I had just... I had done the math and kinda re-worked my budget according to what I thought it was gonna be... Organic milk is so expensive-- Oh... they docked me for the wing.
Oh--
The rip--
Shit--
I guess it was harder to fix than... It wasn’t on a seam so--
Yeah I think Ida had to re-order the fabric.
Oh, she did?
Yeah, just to repair one wing, you know-- and now the show’s gonna end so it’s--
Sure, no I get it--
They’re never gonna need that fabric again, you know, for anything else--
Right-- I’m sorry.
Shouldn’t be sorry, it came out of your paycheck.
Well then... well I’m sorry to me then...
No, God no, they’ll dock me again.
How long you think you’re gonna be?
I dunno... Not that long...
It doesn’t have to be perfect-- only a few shows left.
You know, I’ve been thinking that, for you more than anyone, the end of the show might be kinda upsetting...
Yeah...
You know what’s next?
...No... You?
I’m staying on. Work with the circus.
Oh right-- full schedule.
With the circus. Yeah.
It’s a much easier gig for the money than the R.D. so that’s good.
That’s so lucky. And you’ll still be contributing to your pension, getting health insurance?
Yeah. Anyway, just wanted to check on you.
And... if it means anything,... you’re a real legend, Shell.
...Okay.
Hey Eddie?
Yeah.
Do you want to have dinner with me one night this week?
Do you want to have dinner with me?
Yeah.
Sure. Yeah, of course. That’d be nice.
Okay!
Okay.
Great.
Okay.
Hi, I’m here, Hi Eddie.
Sorry I’m a little late--
No, you’re not--
I was debating dresses-- but I shouldn’t tell you that--
Oh--
Funny story: I didn’t have time to get my nails done so I went to the drug store and right next to my nail files: Your favorite, right?
Thank you, that’s so thoughtful.
I don’t have anything for you.
That’s okay. You look nice.
Thank you.
Do... I look nice?
Oh yes, sorry-- You look really beautiful tonight.
Thanks.
You always look beautiful though.
Aw, thanks Eddie.
But it’s rare I see you in an actual dress and you know, not in like a rhinestone bustier with your breasts... you know... hanging out.
Well. I wouldn’t say hanging.
You do though-- you look really pretty even all covered up.
...Maybe we should order.
How’s Hannah?
She’s about to finish up school--
I wondered for such a long time, where she was and what she was up to, and... and if she looks at all like me--
She doesn’t--
I know, thank God.
What?
What.
What did you say?
Well I ...I met her--
What??
In your dressing room the other night.
Oh-- What did you-- you introduced yourself?? You met her??
No, I mean, I didn’t say who I was--
Thank God--
Does she still live with the Kelly’s?
--She lives-- at college.
I thought that was just going to be a temporary solution.
You’re not in her life so I don’t see how it’s any of your business.
I’m just curious.
She was best friends with Becky and Theo, and Lisa had all the time in the world to devote to her kids, so, you know--
You couldn’t have gotten a sitter?
I made it work, that’s all that matters--
Or I was thinking... you could’a gotten job where you worked when she was at school. You didn’t have to stay with the show.
Of course I did!
You could have worked at a supermarket, waited tables, worked retail--

I can’t win-- cannot just be right in the choices I made! God, this is what women have to deal with. You know, all the time, we’re told: do the thing you didn’t want to do, take the road you chose not to take! Jesus, and how are you saying all this when really-- you were never there? Where were you?
We weren’t even in a relationship...
Well what do you want now? You want to be her father now all of a sudden?
No--
What do you want with me, Eddie??
I just want to to be your friend.
Oh God, this is so embarrassing. I have to go. My friend?? This was a bad idea. This was the worst fucken idea--!
Shelly, wait--
Like you’re in a position to judge me-- You think that’s what a friend does??
I didn’t mean to sound like that--
I should have been in retail?? I love the show! I love it. I feel so good about myself in the show.
Hannah.
What are you doing here?
...Hey.
Hi Shell.
You’re lucky, you’re probably never gonna leave this theater, huh?
Maybe not-- that’s-- you’re probably right-- probably not.
One day your ghost will probably haunt this theater.
Ha-- I never thought about that.
...I can’t believe this is gonna be my last time setting foot on that stage...
...I’m gonna go to Hannah’s graduation. Was thinking about maybe even moving there...
Oh... wow--
...But Annette also said she could help me get a job cocktailing...
Cute outfits.
Not quite like this one...
One last chance to give ‘em hell.
Ha.
Shelly?
You look great, Shell.
